shakeup of its top management, announcing that co-founder Larry Page will replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. He would act as an adviser to Page and Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , who would work on strategic projects and new products. The management changes were due to take effect on April
